data.title: Taaqatwar (1989)
data.meta_description: Amar Sharma, an honest police officer, seeks help from John, a criminal, in a bid to nab the gangster who is responsible for his father's death.
data.text: I’m definitely the outsider looking in but I’m a little surprised at such a low general rating. The plot has been told countless times; two young males separated at youth wind up ultimately defeating the gangster evil that destroyed their young lives with romantic sub plots involving two young ladies on opposite ends of the economic scale, the richer one usually in love with the police officer and definitely daughter of said gangster. Well this is definitely one of those, but it has a bigger (barely) budget than most and some of the floweriest translated dialogue that I’ve ever had the pleasure of reading. I seem to write these reviews mostly for my own pleasure and acts of remembering but…
